result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wally Sostre-Rivera

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wally Sostre-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Wally Sostre-Rivera.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Defense received discovery and an offer. Defense motion to argue bail. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests a resolution date. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Wally Sostre-Rivera in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Wally Sostre-Rivera. Both parties appeared via zoom. Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court vacates previously forfeited signature bond of $2,500.00 and sets $250.00 cash bail. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Wally Sostre-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Wally Sostre-Rivera.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for return on warrant. Bail/bond hearing proceeded. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, Court vacates previously forfeited signature bond of $2,500.00 and sets $250.00 cash bail with conditions. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on September 7, 2022.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until September 13, 2022 at 1:30 PM for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.  Notice is given to Defense Counsel and District Attorney.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,500.00 signature bond) LW
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court in person.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present.  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Violation Report dated June 30, 2022 - received

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Wally Sostre-Rivera in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Wally Sostre-Rivera in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wally Sostre-Rivera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
